TopicTitle: What did you do in KSP1 today?

Articles.Content: Didn't have time to do much, but still managed to land Jeb on one of the dishes of the tracking station for the Kadvent Kalendar challenge.

No pics, but I returned Tomory, Gersey and Adly from Kerbol orbit (they had been drifting in a botched transfer mission from Minmus that got ejected into solar orbit by Mun) They have been orbiting Kerbol for 34 years now. Finally they're back.
This game just got boring, played for about 2hours, and now ... is up with that random reward score... Such a insta win on all upgrades

IRC, I blame you entirely.

Now someone build the things to land it on

( also are there any better IR hinges for folding wings? I can't get them to fold up flush no matter how much I fiddle ).
Last night, I made large (3.75m and 5m) docking ports, for SpaceY.

Made this plane. It's kinda useless... xD

F.A.Q.:

Q. WHY???

A. Sorry, your question is too difficult.

.

Awesome.

I've created a drop jet to use with Mk3 cargo bay of 0.90/0.91 whatever

Edited December 2, 2014 by Daze

I landed on the MÃƒÂ¼n. Nothing special.

I also created my first working plane. I surprised myself, as normally I am horrible at building things with wings.

I landed on the MÃƒÂ¼n. Nothing special.

I also created my first working plane. I surprised myself, as normally I am horrible at building things with wings.

My first plane was made in the vab and had four wings to make it easier to fly at any angle. I then moved it to the sph folder and added parachutes there. I flew it like a rocket though... Was your plane better than that? Show pics.

Was within an in-game hour of losing a Kerbal due to life support depletion while orbiting Mun. Used my remaining dV to make a bee-line back to Kerbin before he died... entered the atmosphere at about 3500 m/s and somehow, amazingly, Douki Kerman landed and survived with no more than a few seconds remaining before he died. Whew. Close call.

IRC, I blame you entirely.

https://farm9.staticflickr.com/8598/15929893262_308fbc8d8e_c.jpg

https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7515/15744739427_47bdbb9e3d_c.jpg

https://farm9.staticflickr.com/8592/15744780167_6e6f123060_c.jpg

https://farm9.staticflickr.com/8646/15310885933_54f102381d_c.jpg

Now someone build the things to land it on

( also are there any better IR hinges for folding wings? I can't get them to fold up flush no matter how much I fiddle ).

That looks so much like something I saw on Thunderbirds...I really didn't think something like that would fly.

Had to fight an undock bug. I had to hard-edit the save file, obliterating my shuttle docked to my ship.

Oh well, a good twist for the plot of my cinematic!

Since the Kraken kindly spread my previous science station over a fair distance, I had to create a cheap rescue mission to save the survivors. Then I made a new science station. It is expanding as funds and new tech become available.
I have built a refueling station in LKO

Successfully launched my first rocket to the Mun, in my first career ( with less rewards than normal and no respawning crew ).

I set up a free return trajectory, but the capsule returned with a high inclination and in the opposite direction as Kerbin's rotation... but don't worry, Bill is safe!

Moreover, I'm fighting against some memory issues and my thread about them is kinda ignored by all

Edited December 2, 2014 by Agost

That looks so much like something I saw on Thunderbirds...I really didn't think something like that would fly.

That is more or less what you saw on Thunderbirds, and nobody ( including me! ) thought it would fly either... was terribly surprised when I was building it and it looked like it might work!

My first plane was made in the vab and had four wings to make it easier to fly at any angle. I then moved it to the sph folder and added parachutes there. I flew it like a rocket though... Was your plane better than that? Show pics.

Here are the pictures!

Did something for fun and discovred magic:

Yeah. I know it has been done before and enjoyed this MÃƒÂ¼n setting too:

Been busy playing with SSTO planes.

Spent a couple of hours trying to complete the Day 2 objectives for the Kadvent Kalendar challenge with a VTOL craft that was A) a bit too big for the job as it turned out and crappy, crappy, crappy - given that the auto-shutoff sequence I'd added didn't work owing to symmetry issues (if you take it off even on accident, you still have to go back and reset all of the action groups). Didn't help that I kept on trying to hit the wrong button. Must've made half-a-dozen attempts at least to land on the astronaut building before I ran out of time for the evening.

Day 3's challenge is looking much easier.

Burning my way to Moho... (for the first time)

Guess the landinglegs weren't necessary.

At least enough dV for returntrip.
Speaking of Moho, this is my WIP sample return mission (sans the stage that's going to do intercept burn).

I finally perfected my large rover, that includes the ability to land on the Mun from orbit, go up to 60 mph on Kerbin, perform all sorts of science, dock with the science lab I have on the Mun, provide thrust for getting up particularly steep terrain, etc. Tested it all out and it worked great.

Then my computer was acting weird, going slow. I shut it down and it just hung there at the shutdown screen for half an hour, so I hit the power button. Now whenever I boot it up it can't find the OS.

Not a good morning.

My first manned Duna landing. Used a SRB to deorbit and it was a perfect arc.

I landed just with chutes and had just enough fuel to get back into orbit and dock with the main ship.

Installed 6.4x RSS last night, and holy crap it's actually hard to get to LKO.

Uninstalled it after an hour or two, but I might put it back on if I download B9 for the bigger thrusters.

I've abandoned my 'Algernon' project. It's long story, but it boils down to a parts count issue... things didn't go as I'd hoped. I have a few pictures I was going to post, but I'm rather displeased with Imgur... I find it a pain in the butt to use. So, apologies for that as well, as I've deleted the Imgur account, so anything I'd put up previously is now a dead link.
